page.title: 15THE M1 MOTORWAY AT RATBY.
page.content:
The M1 Motorway has a profound effect on this area,mainly because it bisects it almost precisely in a SE-NW direction.The building of the motorway in 1966 contrived to cut through farms and through Martinshaw Wood,the principal feature of the area.It now provides the major road link from London to the Midlands and the North. Traffic on the motorway is inevitably heavy,the following table giving some idea of this:
Southbound Northbound MAY 15th 1800 2260
JULY 15th 1674 1620
Both are hourly rates at 1500 hours.Lorries constitute one third of all traffic counted.
